description.narrative: The project will pursue regulations and labelling for the three categories of appliances and equipment with the highest electricity consumption and impact – refrigerators, industrial motors, and distribution transformers.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
1. Reduction in electricity consumption by refrigerators, distribution transformers, and electric motors
2. Reduction in GHG emissions from electricity consumption by refrigerators, distribution transformers, and electric motors

comment.narrative:
1. 40 TWh of electricity per year consumed by refrigerators, motors, and distribution transformers (transformer losses), projected to grow to 87 TWh per year by 2030 under business as usual
2. 37 million tonnes of CO2 emissions per year from electricity consumption by refrigerators, motors, and distribution transformers, projected to grow to 80 million tonnes of CO2 emissions per year by 2030 under business as usual

1. Development of legal documentations for MEPS acceptance at the national level related to distributive transformers and refrigerators 2. Organization of a field technical training for a group of experts and responsible specialists to have a practical familiarization with methodology and infrastructure of testing labs 3. Creation of a test version of a web-portal for products and which would show data on energy efficiency of domestic appliances and equipment. 4. Sociological research on consumers’ awareness about advantages of energy efficient equipment and appliances covering the gender balance (information for the middle-term evaluation). 5. Market research with covering the gender balance: current quantities, trends in sales and use of refrigerators, other domestic appliances, also electric motors and transformers in the context of energy efficiency, product life cycle, and other key factors 6. Analysis of financial mechanisms on granting discounts and/or coupons for energy efficient equipment (2500 persons): discounts system in regions. 7. Implementation of an express energy audit on an industrial enterprise based on the developed methodology within 1.1 component.

1. Elaboration of regulative acts and accompanying amendments to the Law on Energy Saving, related to energy efficiency requirements. 2. Development of regulative act for purchase of distributive transformers by state authorities. 3. Development of standards for household appliances (televisions, external power supplies, electric ovens, stoves, circulation pumps) 4. Purchase of necessary equipment for testing energy efficiency parameters for testing laboratories 5. Sociological research on consumers’ awareness about advantages of energy efficient equipment and appliances covering the gender balance (information for the middle-term evaluation). 6. Market research with covering the gender balance: current quantities, trends in sales and use of refrigerators, other domestic appliances, electric motors and transformers in the context of energy efficiency, product life cycle, and other key factors. 7. Analysis of financial mechanisms on granting discounts and/or coupons for energy efficient equipment (2500 persons, women 60%): discounts system in regions. 8. Support to domestic manufacturers of distribution transformers

1. On April 28, 2020, the Order of the Minister of Investment and Development of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated March 31, 2015 No. 407 On the establishment of energy efficiency requirements for technological processes, equipment, including electrical equipment was amended with the minimum energy performance standards (MEPS) for refrigerators and transformers: - since May 2020, energy efficiency indices of more than 55 (EEI> 55) have been established for refrigeration devices; - since May 2020, minimum energy efficiency requirements are imposed on transformers - one of the energy efficiency parameters (no-load losses and (or) short-circuit losses) of 6-10 kV distribution transformers must correspond to energy efficiency class 2 or higher.
2. Proposals and recommendations developed by the Project on implementation of energy efficiency requirements for state and quasi-public procurement, included in the Concept of the draft Law of the Republic of Kazakhstan On Amendments and Additions to Certain Legislative Acts of the Republic of Kazakhstan on Energy Saving and Energy Efficiency Improvement were approved by the Office of the Prime Minister of the Republic of Kazakhstan and the Administration of the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan. These norms in the draft Law were submitted to the Mazhilis of the Parliament of the Republic of Kazakhstan, they were discussed at meetings of the Committee on Legislation and Judicial and Legal Reform, as well as the Committee on International Affairs, Defense and Security of the Mazhilis of the Parliament of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
3. Drafts of 4 national ST RK standards have been developed to establish requirements for energy efficiency of household appliances and equipment (TVs, external power supplies, electric ovens and stoves, circulation pumps). The standards are at the final stage of adoption, according to the requirements of the legislation, it is necessary to carry out the following activities: 1. Discussion at the Scientific and Technical Council; 2. Approval of national standards by order of the Committee for Technical Regulation of the Republic of Kazakhstan; 3. Entry into the register of the national standardization system of national standards.
At the same time, due to the audit, some activities on the Project were suspended, including the completion of work in this area.
4. Prepared technical specifications and ToR for launch of a tender for purchase of 2 laboratory stands for testing energy efficiency parameters of refrigerators and electric motors. The tender was held and proposals from companies were received, but due to the audit, some activities on the Project were suspended, including the completion of work in this area.
5. Conducted social study on consumer awareness about benefits of energy efficient appliances and equipment. Within the framework of the study: - 2500 consumers were questioned in all regions of the country. - Identified awareness of energy efficiency energy saving concepts and their influence on consumer choices. - Prepared dynamics of changes regarding the baseline of public awareness.
6. Conducted market research of current stock and trends in sales of electric motors, transformers, refrigerators, freezers and other household appliances and equipment with the focus on energy efficiency and other key factors. Within the framework of the study prepared:  Detailed description of the overall structure and volume of the market of refrigerators, external power supplies, TVs, monitors, electric household stoves (ovens), stoves, circular pumps, electric motors and transformers in Kazakhstan, with a breakdown by types and classes of energy efficiency;  Assesment of import/production volumes in 2017-2019 of household appliances and industrial equipment;  Analysis of foreign economic activity in terms of imports and exports volumes of the above appliances and equipment, including the list of the main countries of origin/production
7. As part of the campaign to provide the population with discounts for energy efficient refrigerators, tender documents and terms of reference were prepared. According to the results of the tender, none of the companies’ bids passed the technical evaluation. In accordance with the recommendations of the MTR report, it was proposed to stop this activity, therefore the tender was not re-announced until the final decision is taken.
8. Analysis of the current state of production of transformers at the Ural Transformer Plant. The analysis assesses energy efficiency of the technologies used at the plant and provides recommendations for the further development of the transformer industry. Developed proposals for technological innovations for energy efficient transformers production process including magnetic circuits from cold rolled and amorphous steels. Proposals were based on the results of the study tour to enterprises of the Peoples Republic of China and technical training conducted there for the responsible specialists of the Kentau and Ural transformer plants.

1. Expert support for amending the Law of the Republic of Kazakhstan On Energy Saving and Improving Energy Efficiency on state procurement requirements for energy efficient household appliances and equipment in Kazakhstan (contributions to analytical reports, comparative tables, justifications, expert opinions). 2. Finalization of the draft general methodology for testing household electrical appliances and equipment through consultations and contributing to the Methodology for testing household electrical appliances on energy efficiency, for training specialists of testing laboratories. Theoretical course Part 1 Refrigerators, washing machines, air conditioners . 3. Web portal update, consultations with the stakeholders on handing off to responsible agency 4. Preparation of an article on testing electrical appliances for energy efficiency in accordance with the requirements of the EAEU and the Republic of Kazakhstan.

1. In cooperation with experts from the Office of Energy Saving and Energy Efficiency Improvement of the MIID RK, the following materials were prepared within the framework of revision of the draft Law of the Republic of Kazakhstan On Amendments and Additions to Certain Legislative Acts of the Republic of Kazakhstan on Energy Saving and Energy Efficiency Improvement , which is under discussion in the Parliament of the Republic of Kazakhstan: - a comparative table to the draft Law with description of proposed amendments or additions related to introduction of energy efficiency requirements into public procurement procedures for household appliances and equipment; - information notes on energy efficiency of household appliances and equipment; - responses to comments regarding the norms of introduction of energy efficiency requirements into public procurement procedures for household appliances and equipment. Discussions of the norms of the draft Law were held at meetings of the Committee on Ecology and Nature Management of the Mazhilis of the Parliament of the Republic of Kazakhstan. During the reporting period, 5 meetings were held - on April 7, 15 and 29; May 20 and June 3, 2021. Based on the results of these meetings, the norms on energy efficient public procurement processes for household appliances and equipment remain in the draft law and are recommended for further discussion At the same time, due to the audit, some activities on the Project were suspended, including the completion of work in this area. 2. Methodology for testing household electrical appliances for energy efficiency for training specialists from testing laboratories. Theoretical course Part 1 Refrigerators, washing machines, air conditioners (draft) . This general test methodology for household electrical appliances is intended for laboratories and based on the standards developed in the Republic of Kazakhstan and the EAEU Regulations; The developed document was sent to a number of Testing Laboratories and to the Department of Energy Saving of the Seifullin Kazakh Agro Technical University, corrections were made by the authors, comments and suggestions were considered, and a working Edition 2 was prepared. Developed proposals and comments for the MIID RK on the analysis of implementation of the EAEU Technical Regulations on MEPS TR EAEU 048/2019; In accordance with the MIIDs request, Information Note was prepared for the Ministry of Energy titled “Assessment of the park of power transformers for voltages up to 20 kV inclusive in the Republic of Kazakhstan”, based on the assessments of international experts on the EESL project. The Information Note was forwarded to the Ministry, a corresponding explanation was made on the issues under consideration
At the same time, due to the audit, some activities on the Project were suspended, including the completion of work in this area. 3. All the necessary materials have been prepared for transfer of the web portal of energy efficient products http://unemdi-energia.kz/ to a responsible state agency for further administration (registration data, description of technical characteristics, instructions for administrating the web portal). At the same time, due to the audit, some activities on the Project were suspended, including the completion of work in this area. 4. A draft article has been prepared: “Issues of methodological support for digitalization and automation of energy efficiency tests in accordance with the requirements of the EAEU and the Republic of Kazakhstan”. At the same time, due to the audit, some activities on the Project were suspended, including the completion of work in this area.
